newsitem.title: USA: Huntway sees improved Q1 results.
newsitem.headline: Huntway sees improved Q1 results.

text.p: Huntway Partners L.P. said Monday it expects results for its first quarter of 1997 will significantly beat those for the comparable year-ago period.
In the 1996 first quarter the company reported a loss of $2.2 million, or $0.19 per unit, on revenues of $17.2 million.
The company said in a statement the improved operating results are due to improved product margins for both light-end products and asphalt.
Huntway owns and operates two refineries in California which primarily process California crude oil to produce liquid asphalt for use in road construction and repair.
The company's third refinery, in Arizona, has been shut down since 1993.
